page.title: 11LOCAL BUSINESSES CONTINUED
page.content: At Elms Farm there is a carpenter. He has got one helper and uses about three large machines. The carpenter makes furniture and repairs antiques but the best and most important thing is that he makes mendlesham chairs. Mendlesham chairs have been made in the area since about 1780. They are wooden chairs with arms and have at least three bobbles and a carved bar on the back. The chairs can be made out of pine, cherry, elm or walnut and can be made in different sizes. The carpenter takes orders and makes them specially to order for people. They take a long time to make and cost about 400 pounds to buy. There are two very old mendlesham chairs in the church.
